data_window module¶

Module implementing the MainWindow to the calculator example

class data_node_editor.data_window.DataWindow¶

Bases: node_editor.node_editor_window.NodeEditorWindow

Class representing the MainWindow of the application.

It implements multiple documents area as well as two docks on the left and right. The left one displays a list of nodes. The right one displays parameters for some nodes.

Instance Attributes

name_company and name_product - used to register the settings mdiArea - Multiple Document Area holding the NodeEditor Widget

initUI()¶

UI is composed of two docks : - the one on the left is used to display nodes available to use. - the one on the right displays properties of the selected node.

createActions()¶

Instantiate various QAction for the main toolbar.

File and Edit menu actions are instantiated in the :classs:~`node_editor.node_editor_widget.NodeEditorWidget` Window and Help actions are specific to the :class:~`examples.calc_window.CalcWindow`

createMenus()¶

Populate File, Edit, Window and Help with QAction

createToolBars()¶
createPropertiesDock()¶
createNodesDock()¶

Create Nodes Dock and populates it with the list of Nodes

The Nodes are automatically detected via the :class:~`examples.calc_drag_listbox.QNEDragListBox`

createStatusBar()¶

Utility function, instantiate the status bar notifying the cursor position in the scene

onFileNew()¶

Create a new mdi Child

onFileOpen()¶

Open OpenFileDialog

Event handling the visibility of the Nodes Dock

closeEvent(event: PyQt5.QtGui.QCloseEvent) → None¶

Close if no change is detected, else prompt a dialog asking to save.

Gray the properties of the editMenu in function of the active subwindow

Return the widget currently holding the scene.

For different application, the method can be overridden to return mdiArea, the central widget…

Node editor Widget. The widget holding the scene.
